body: [When someone claims to be libleft but wants to ban free speech](https://i.imgur.com/uNVQHtZ.png)
body_html: When someone claims to be libleft but wants to ban free speech

body:
You aren't free from consequences from the mob. The Constitution doesn't protect you from mob justice. And people are going to do what people are going to do. If you speak out of line, someone may attack you violently. Or they may attack your place of business. There are a lot of angry people out there, so don't upset them.

Here, why don't you tell me your thoughts and I can explain how you can be more compassionate to the angry mob. It's not enough to speak your mind. You have to change your mind before you speak. Think about whether it would make the mob angry, and if it would, don't say it. And remind your friends and family about this duty. If they say something that would anger the mob, make sure they realize their mistake. If you let them say those things and you don't correct them, you may be seen as an ally to white supremacy. And that makes the mob angry.

Freedom means being on an equal footing. Remember how privileged you are to have a life you live in peace. If you don't follow these steps, the mob isn't going to let you live in peace. And the mob is already mad at you for not having followed these steps before, so you are already indebted to them in a way. You already deserve punishment. So that's just another privilege you know you have. So be thankful for the mob for correcting your evil behavior. And if they ask for help, you already owe it to them to give in any way you can. After all, it is them who gave you the peace of mind you had leading up to the riots.

Group cohesion (love) trumps unconventional thought (hate).

body: So you want communism? Where the individual doesn't matter at all, and you are society's slave? Where the majority is always right, and dissent cannot be tolerated in the name of the great human order? Where mass oppression and blind hiveminds is called love and good and freedom is called hate? How is that such a glorious utopia?

body: For the libleft people. How can you actually achieve a form of comunism without authority? I get the libright anarchism, but the left one confuses me

body:
>Freedom means being on an equal footing.

That's why liberty is preferable to freedom. Liberty means freedom as long as it doesn't come at the expense of others. 
>The Constitution doesn't protect you from mob justice.

So murder is okay by constitutional standards. Great, guess I'll go kill someone. 
>There are a lot of angry people out there, so don't upset them.

Shut up and follow the crowd. That sure worked great for 99% of the people on this site. 
>And the mob is already mad at you for not having followed these steps before, so you are already indebted to them in a way.

I owe nobody nothing. Existing and having an opinion are not logical grounds to silence someone unless you think murder and assault are acceptable pastimes. Hell why not just rape somebody.

>After all, it is them who gave you the peace of mind you had leading up to the riots.

Placing the onus of blame on individuals for the mob violence of millions. I thought original sin was a bit harsh.

Speaking as an anarchist, I know a society without laws is for the most part fantasy and violence has been necessary to defend one's way of life, but I also think a world where people live like this is completely fucking stupid. If someone has an opinion, get over it. I don't like white nationalists either, but it's never made me think I need to take hours and days and weeks and months out of my life to take them out. Grow the fuck up, and get a life.
body_html:

That's why liberty is preferable to freedom. Liberty means freedom as long as it doesn't come at the expense of others.

The Constitution doesn't protect you from mob justice.

So murder is okay by constitutional standards. Great, guess I'll go kill someone.

There are a lot of angry people out there, so don't upset them.

Shut up and follow the crowd. That sure worked great for 99% of the people on this site.

And the mob is already mad at you for not having followed these steps before, so you are already indebted to them in a way.

I owe nobody nothing. Existing and having an opinion are not logical grounds to silence someone unless you think murder and assault are acceptable pastimes. Hell why not just rape somebody.

After all, it is them who gave you the peace of mind you had leading up to the riots.

Placing the onus of blame on individuals for the mob violence of millions. I thought original sin was a bit harsh.

Speaking as an anarchist, I know a society without laws is for the most part fantasy and violence has been necessary to defend one's way of life, but I also think a world where people live like this is completely fucking stupid. If someone has an opinion, get over it. I don't like white nationalists either, but it's never made me think I need to take hours and days and weeks and months out of my life to take them out. Grow the fuck up, and get a life.

body: Honestly, anarcho-communism is the only libleft ideology I actually understand. Typically libleft is kind of an oxymoron, because controlling the economy is authoritarian, but there is a tipping point where if you abolish *all* kinds of property enforcement everything would become collectively owned. Of course when you do that the anarchist part never lasts, because it would quickly become mob rule and then you'd end up with something like a direct democracy, where the majority holds absolute rule over everything. The only way the non-anarchist libleft beliefs can be explained is that they would want a tightly controlled economy but are non-interventionist in everything else. That's kind of a weird situation though. Generally authoritarians desire more power, which usually means more economic control aka left, and the lib side supports freedom and therefore free markets too (right). I don't know of very many liblefts, and I have yet to learn about a single genuine authright.
body_html: Honestly, anarcho-communism is the only libleft ideology I actually understand. Typically libleft is kind of an oxymoron, because controlling the economy is authoritarian, but there is a tipping point where if you abolish all kinds of property enforcement everything would become collectively owned. Of course when you do that the anarchist part never lasts, because it would quickly become mob rule and then you'd end up with something like a direct democracy, where the majority holds absolute rule over everything. The only way the non-anarchist libleft beliefs can be explained is that they would want a tightly controlled economy but are non-interventionist in everything else. That's kind of a weird situation though. Generally authoritarians desire more power, which usually means more economic control aka left, and the lib side supports freedom and therefore free markets too (right). I don't know of very many liblefts, and I have yet to learn about a single genuine authright.

body: They're not "anarchists", they're just communists hiding behind that label (and I don't mean an-coms either, actual communists). They want to overthrow the current state only because they want to implement their own even worse one instead. The fact that they're behaving this violently alone should show where they really stand, and they even openly admit support for complete mob rule, banning free speech, banning guns, etc.

Typically libleft is kind of an oxymoron, because controlling the economy is authoritarian, but there is a tipping point where if you abolish *all* kinds of property enforcement everything would become collectively owned. Of course when you do that the anarchist part never lasts, because it would quickly become mob rule and then you'd end up with something like a direct democracy, where the majority holds absolute rule over everything. The only way the non-anarchist libleft beliefs can be explained is that they would want a tightly controlled economy but are non-interventionist in everything else. That's kind of a weird situation though. Generally authoritarians desire more power, which usually means more economic control aka left, and the lib side supports freedom and therefore free markets too (right). I don't know of very many liblefts, and I have yet to learn about a single genuine authright.
parent.body_html: Honestly, anarcho-communism is the only libleft ideology I actually understand. Typically libleft is kind of an oxymoron, because controlling the economy is authoritarian, but there is a tipping point where if you abolish all kinds of property enforcement everything would become collectively owned. Of course when you do that the anarchist part never lasts, because it would quickly become mob rule and then you'd end up with something like a direct democracy, where the majority holds absolute rule over everything. The only way the non-anarchist libleft beliefs can be explained is that they would want a tightly controlled economy but are non-interventionist in everything else. That's kind of a weird situation though. Generally authoritarians desire more power, which usually means more economic control aka left, and the lib side supports freedom and therefore free markets too (right). I don't know of very many liblefts, and I have yet to learn about a single genuine authright.

body: Some of the tests skew extremely in one direction, which is usually libleft for some reason. Just make sure you actually align with the results it gives you before you label yourself as such. For example on the politicalcompass.org one it's near impossible to not get libleft, even if you're ultra-authright.

parent.body:
You aren't free from consequences from the mob. The Constitution doesn't protect you from mob justice. And people are going to do what people are going to do. If you speak out of line, someone may attack you violently. Or they may attack your place of business. There are a lot of angry people out there, so don't upset them.

Here, why don't you tell me your thoughts and I can explain how you can be more compassionate to the angry mob. It's not enough to speak your mind. You have to change your mind before you speak. Think about whether it would make the mob angry, and if it would, don't say it. And remind your friends and family about this duty. If they say something that would anger the mob, make sure they realize their mistake. If you let them say those things and you don't correct them, you may be seen as an ally to white supremacy. And that makes the mob angry.

Freedom means being on an equal footing. Remember how privileged you are to have a life you live in peace. If you don't follow these steps, the mob isn't going to let you live in peace. And the mob is already mad at you for not having followed these steps before, so you are already indebted to them in a way. You already deserve punishment. So that's just another privilege you know you have. So be thankful for the mob for correcting your evil behavior. And if they ask for help, you already owe it to them to give in any way you can. After all, it is them who gave you the peace of mind you had leading up to the riots.

Group cohesion (love) trumps unconventional thought (hate).

body: Thanks. Especially our last point makes a lot of sense. I guess people on the right look Auth to the people on the left because they are less relativist, especially from a moral/society standpoint, at the same time they think at themselves as lib because they all agree on most of those things (and most of the people also agrees with them, they just want other people to be able to do what they want), there's also the never-ending question about what is the limit between freedom of the individual and health of the wider society, also to what point should we limit the individual to do what may constitute harm to himself, and who is it that defines that...

parent.body:
>Freedom means being on an equal footing.

That's why liberty is preferable to freedom. Liberty means freedom as long as it doesn't come at the expense of others. 
>The Constitution doesn't protect you from mob justice.

So murder is okay by constitutional standards. Great, guess I'll go kill someone. 
>There are a lot of angry people out there, so don't upset them.

Shut up and follow the crowd. That sure worked great for 99% of the people on this site. 
>And the mob is already mad at you for not having followed these steps before, so you are already indebted to them in a way.

I owe nobody nothing. Existing and having an opinion are not logical grounds to silence someone unless you think murder and assault are acceptable pastimes. Hell why not just rape somebody.

>After all, it is them who gave you the peace of mind you had leading up to the riots.

Placing the onus of blame on individuals for the mob violence of millions. I thought original sin was a bit harsh.

Speaking as an anarchist, I know a society without laws is for the most part fantasy and violence has been necessary to defend one's way of life, but I also think a world where people live like this is completely fucking stupid. If someone has an opinion, get over it. I don't like white nationalists either, but it's never made me think I need to take hours and days and weeks and months out of my life to take them out. Grow the fuck up, and get a life.

Freedom means being on an equal footing.

That's why liberty is preferable to freedom. Liberty means freedom as long as it doesn't come at the expense of others.

The Constitution doesn't protect you from mob justice.

So murder is okay by constitutional standards. Great, guess I'll go kill someone.

There are a lot of angry people out there, so don't upset them.

Shut up and follow the crowd. That sure worked great for 99% of the people on this site.

And the mob is already mad at you for not having followed these steps before, so you are already indebted to them in a way.

I owe nobody nothing. Existing and having an opinion are not logical grounds to silence someone unless you think murder and assault are acceptable pastimes. Hell why not just rape somebody.

After all, it is them who gave you the peace of mind you had leading up to the riots.

Placing the onus of blame on individuals for the mob violence of millions. I thought original sin was a bit harsh.

Speaking as an anarchist, I know a society without laws is for the most part fantasy and violence has been necessary to defend one's way of life, but I also think a world where people live like this is completely fucking stupid. If someone has an opinion, get over it. I don't like white nationalists either, but it's never made me think I need to take hours and days and weeks and months out of my life to take them out. Grow the fuck up, and get a life.

body:
I feel like I'm taking crazy pills sometimes because I'm hearing these black Marxists from the 60s on left-wing media programs, and the journalists aren't even critical of the communist sentiments.

Even left wing journalists have been critical of Marxists before this summer. But now that old school civil rights activists are amongst the Marxists, the journalists are too afraid to confront the narrative.

body:
The State has always existed on a collectivist narrative. For the entire history of the US the states and particularly the federal government has increased and consolidated it's power, just like all States have. The left has now reached a critical mass allowing the Overton window to be pushed more aggressively towards socialism than previously expected. This has forced the silence, virtue signalling, or radicalization of the more moderates.  

It's a classic tactic, just unfamiliar rhetoric within the US. A problem is identified or created, the State uses it's agents to stoke the existing FUD within the populace, it graciously accepts responsibility for the safety and security of those who are unwilling to be responsible for themselves, it deems within it's power any actions which it feels might be helpful it carrying out the stated goals and exercises that power over all the useful fools and unwilling slaves within it's claimed jurisdiction. Whether it's left wing social garbage or right wing police state, the stinking carrion bird in the middle keeps getting fatter off the dwindling number of creators of value it has control over.
  

There have been vanishingly few journalists in the old media for many years. They are simply mouthpieces for corporate and state forces. The journalism that occurs now is conducted by independent individuals or small teams, and is often censored to avoid threat to the narratives.
body_html:
The State has always existed on a collectivist narrative. For the entire history of the US the states and particularly the federal government has increased and consolidated it's power, just like all States have. The left has now reached a critical mass allowing the Overton window to be pushed more aggressively towards socialism than previously expected. This has forced the silence, virtue signalling, or radicalization of the more moderates.

It's a classic tactic, just unfamiliar rhetoric within the US. A problem is identified or created, the State uses it's agents to stoke the existing FUD within the populace, it graciously accepts responsibility for the safety and security of those who are unwilling to be responsible for themselves, it deems within it's power any actions which it feels might be helpful it carrying out the stated goals and exercises that power over all the useful fools and unwilling slaves within it's claimed jurisdiction. Whether it's left wing social garbage or right wing police state, the stinking carrion bird in the middle keeps getting fatter off the dwindling number of creators of value it has control over.

There have been vanishingly few journalists in the old media for many years. They are simply mouthpieces for corporate and state forces. The journalism that occurs now is conducted by independent individuals or small teams, and is often censored to avoid threat to the narratives.
